content: Morning Rohan. Just a reminder your mid-quarter blood draw is booked for tomorrow 8:00am at Camden Medical. Nurse will be ready for you - should take under 15 mins.
Got it, Ruby. I'll be there on time. Thanks for lining it up.
Strength Phase 2 looking solid ðŸ’ª This week I've kept Wed light in case work travel pops up again. We'll adjust if needed.
Smart move, Rachel. Travel's actually looking likely mid-week...
Thanks for the heads-upâ€”if it firms up, we'll deploy the US Travel Protocol v3.0 so you're fully covered.
Blood draw done âœ… Smooth process.
Perfect. Lab's already processing. Warren will review results by Wed. I'll share updates as soon as anything comes in.
Confirmed. NYC trip Wed night to Sat. High-stakes client meetings.
Understood. Team's on it. Expect full travel protocol by tonight - nutrition, light exposure, hotel workouts, all synced.
Protocol sent. Key point: this trip is a live test of your Q2 KPI - maintaining HRV stability during long-haul stress. Light exposure & meal timing chart attached.
Got it. Appreciate the framing, Advik. Makes it feel like a mission.
Sent you 5 vetted restaurants within walking distance of your hotel - menus lean high-protein, low refined carbs.
That's a lifesaver, Carla. I'll stick to the list.
You'll have a 20-min hotel room mobility + HIIT session in your app. Works in tight spaces, no equipment needed.
Morning Rohan. Great to see how quickly the team turned this around. You've now got full resilience coverage for the trip.
Yep, feels like nothing falls through the cracks now. Thanks Neel.
Boarding now. Meal options on plane look off-plan. What's the least bad choice?
Go for grilled chicken or fish, skip the bread & dessert. Ask for extra salad if they have it. Hydrate steadily, no alcohol.
Done. Chicken & greens it is.
Thinking about hormesis... would a short cold shower after arrival be a useful stressor to help with jet lag, or just overload?
Nice question. In your case, mild cold exposure (30-60s) after light & movement on arrival can aid circadian reset without tipping recovery load. Avoid if HRV tanks.
Got it. Will monitor HRV before trying it.
Client dinner tonight runs over my workout slot.
No problem - swap to 15-min bodyweight HIIT tomorrow AM before meetings. You'll still get the key adaptation stimulus.
Perfect, thanks for flexing it.
Workout done before sunrise. It felt really good, not sluggish.
Love it. Shows your adaptation's holding even under travel stress.
Initial lab result: hs-CRP down 40% since July. Excellent systemic improvement. Full ApoB pending.
That's motivating. Appreciate the quick share, Warren/
NYC temps dropping tonight. Pack scarf & gloves for morning walks to avoid extra immune stress.
Will do. Already feeling the chill here.
Morning HRV steady at 68, no drop despite the travel. Feels like the protocol's working.
That's exactly the KPI we wanted to prove. Let's hold through the weekend and debrief Monday.
If you grab lunch out, opt for lean protein + veg, skip creamy sauces. Keeps energy stable for afternoon sessions.
Copy that. Grilled salmon & steamed veg ordered.
Flight back tomorrow. Shall I arrange light compression socks & hydration pack in your seat?
Yes please. Helps a ton on the return leg.
You've handled this week like a pro - key markers held, no major drops. Shows we're building real resilience.
Feels that way on my end too. Big thanks to the whole team.
Safe flight back, Rohan. We'll have a quick post-trip debrief Monday to lock in the wins.
